content: ipod nano cozy - designed by arianne donoghue this is for the newer 3g ipod nano with video gauge isn t hugely important here - and the pattern is very easy to size up or down if you want to make a cozy for another device yarn used for examples sirdar denim chunky hook 5 0mm other items tapestry needle button cozy chain 20 and without twisting chain join with slip_stitch in first chain check that this loop fits around the circumference of your ipod add or remove chain as appropriate you want a snug fit 1 row 1 chain 1 1 single_crochet in each chain around slip_stitch in first single_crochet to join - 20 single_crochet row 2 - 16 chain 1 single_crochet in each st around slip_stitch in first single_crochet to join - 20 single_crochet 2 row 17 slip_stitch in first 6 stitches 1 single_crochet in each of next 9 st - 9 single_crochet chain 1 turn row 18-20 single_crochet in each stitch along - 9sc chain 1 turn row 21 single_crochet in first 3 st chain 3 skip 3 chain 3 chain 1 turn row 22 single_crochet in each st along including the 3 chain - 9 single_crochet chain 1 turn row 23 single_crochet in each stitch along - 9 single_crochet chain 1 row 24 single_crochet in each stitch along - 9 single_crochet fasten_off and weave in end pocket starting row chain 9 row 1 single_crochet in 2nd stitch from hook single_crochet in each stitch along - 8 single_crochet chain 1 weave in tail as you go row 2-12 single_crochet in each stitch along - 8 single_crochet chain 1 row 13 single_crochet in each stitch along - 8 single_crochet fasten_off leaving a 12 inch tail assembly attach the pocket using the tail to the cozy underneath the flap to what will be the back of the cozy tie off and weave in ends turn the cozy inside out using the tail at the bottom stitch the bottom seams together turn the right way out tie off and weave in tail 3 weave in any remaining ends affix button 4 to size this up or down you need to ensure that your initial chain is enough to completely go around the circumference of your device then do the appropriate number of row to ensure that your item will be completely covered - normally about 2-4 more than the device is tall the flap is half as tall as the cozy itself so if your cozy is 20 row tall your flap needs to be 10 tall the flap is then also half as wide so if your cozy is 10 stitches wide your flap needs to be 5 stitches wide for the buttonhole on that row just ensure that you divide the length of your row into thirds - then single_crochet one third chain and skip another then single_crochet the last third in the event of the row not being an exact multiple of 3 make the button hole
